universum.studios.android.ui.widget

Class CalendarView.SimpleCalendarAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter
      • universum.studios.android.ui.widget.CalendarView.SimpleCalendarAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CalendarView.CalendarAdapter
    Enclosing class:
    CalendarView

    public static class CalendarView.SimpleCalendarAdapter
extends RecyclerView.Adapter
implements CalendarView.CalendarAdapter
    A CalendarView.CalendarAdapter implementation that provides simple data set of months for CalendarView. This adapter implementation creates instances of MonthView as its item views and uses CalendarView.CalendarDataSet helper to properly provide data set of months.
    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky

      • SimpleCalendarAdapter

        public SimpleCalendarAdapter(@NonNull
                             Context context,
                             @NonNull
                             CalendarView.CalendarDataSet dataSet)
        Creates a new instance of SimpleCalendarAdapter to provide data set of months.
        Parameters:
        context - Context in which will be the new adapter used. This context will be used when creating item views for the adapter.
        dataSet - Calendar data set used to provide set of months for the desired min + max date boundaries.

      • setMinMaxDate

        public void setMinMaxDate(long minDateInMillis,
                          long maxDateInMillis)
        Description copied from interface: CalendarView.CalendarAdapter
        Sets a date boundaries for months data set of this adapter. These dates are used to resolve when the months data set should start and how large (in count of months) should be.
        Specified by:
        setMinMaxDate in interface CalendarView.CalendarAdapter
        Parameters:
        minDateInMillis - The desired minimum date in milliseconds.
        maxDateInMillis - The desired maximum date in milliseconds.
        See Also:
        CalendarView.CalendarAdapter.getDateMinInMillis(), CalendarView.CalendarAdapter.getDateMaxInMillis()

      • onCreateViewHolder

        public RecyclerView.ViewHolder onCreateViewHolder(ViewGroup parent,
                                                  int viewType)
        Description copied from class: android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter
        Called when RecyclerView needs a new RecyclerView.ViewHolder of the given type to represent an item.

        This new ViewHolder should be constructed with a new View that can represent the items of the given type. You can either create a new View manually or inflate it from an XML layout file.

        The new ViewHolder will be used to display items of the adapter using #onBindViewHolder(ViewHolder, int, List). Since it will be re-used to display different items in the data set, it is a good idea to cache references to sub views of the View to avoid unnecessary View.findViewById(int) calls.

        Specified by:
        onCreateViewHolder in class RecyclerView.Adapter
        Parameters:
        parent - The ViewGroup into which the new View will be added after it is bound to an adapter position.
        viewType - The view type of the new View.
        Returns:
        A new ViewHolder that holds a View of the given view type.
        See Also:
        RecyclerView.Adapter.getItemViewType(int), #onBindViewHolder(ViewHolder, int)

      • onBindViewHolder

        public void onBindViewHolder(RecyclerView.ViewHolder holder,
                             int position)
        Description copied from class: android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter
        Called by RecyclerView to display the data at the specified position. This method should update the contents of the RecyclerView.ViewHolder.itemView to reflect the item at the given position.

        Note that unlike ListView, RecyclerView will not call this method again if the position of the item changes in the data set unless the item itself is invalidated or the new position cannot be determined. For this reason, you should only use the position parameter while acquiring the related data item inside this method and should not keep a copy of it. If you need the position of an item later on (e.g. in a click listener), use RecyclerView.ViewHolder.getAdapterPosition() which will have the updated adapter position. Override #onBindViewHolder(ViewHolder, int, List) instead if Adapter can handle efficient partial bind.

        Specified by:
        onBindViewHolder in class RecyclerView.Adapter
        Parameters:
        holder - The ViewHolder which should be updated to represent the contents of the item at the given position in the data set.
        position - The position of the item within the adapter's data set.

      • onBindViewHolder

        protected void onBindViewHolder(@NonNull
                                RecyclerView.ViewHolder holder,
                                int position,
                                long dateInMillis)
        Invoked from #onBindViewHolder(ViewHolder, int) with the given dateInMillis that is associated with the MonthView at the position according to the current data set size.
        Parameters:
        holder - View holder to bind.
        position - The position for which to perform binding.
        dateInMillis - Date in milliseconds obtained for the month position via CalendarView.CalendarDataSet.getMonthDate(int).
